definition: lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
variant of 草[cao3]
grass/straw/manuscript/draft (of a document)/careless/rough/CL:棵[ke1],撮[zuo3],株[zhu1],根[gen1]
variant of 肏[cao4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

snake/serpent/CL:條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: I know how to be invisible.
sentences.chinese: 我知道如何不打草惊蛇。

sentences.english: The above story provided the idiom "Beat the grass and startle the snake".
sentences.chinese: 由此产生了“打草惊蛇”这个成语。

sentences.english: By that time not cause undesired agitation, will also the your wife isn't rapid.
sentences.chinese: 到时不只打草惊蛇，也会令夫人不快。

sentences.english: His second impulse therefore was to let sleeping dogs lie .
sentences.chinese: 他的第二个冲动是不必打草惊蛇。

definition: to divulge secrets
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to act blindly without thinking (idiom)
to follow sb/to tail/to shadow
to monitor secretly/to spy on
whereabouts/(lose) track (of)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
to walk right into the trap
to prepare an ambush/to waylay
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
